pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces two main definitions:
- `wellOrderSucc a`: the successor of an element `a` in a well-ordered type
- the typeclass `IsWellOrderLimitElement a` which asserts that an element `a` (in a well-ordered type) is neither a successor nor the smallest element, i.e. `a` is a limit element

Then, the lemma `eq_bot_or_eq_succ_or_isWellOrderLimitElement` shows that an element in a well-ordered type is either `⊥`, a successor, or a limit element.


---

These definitions are important in my formalization of the small object argument in category theory as it involves constructions of functors by transfinite induction.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: Thanks @kbuzzard for the review!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8713443557/job/23901840997)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8713443557/job/23901841310)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8713443557/job/23901841633)

I found this PR from #12211. I think instead of building a separate IsWellOrderLimitElement API, we should make [SuccOrder.ofLinearWellFoundedLT](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Basic.html#SuccOrder.ofLinearWellFoundedLT) locally an instance to equip the well order with a SuccOrder structure and use `SuccOrder.succ` and [Order.IsSuccLimit](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Limit.html#Order.IsSuccLimit). This is the approach taken in my #9480.

The instances `LinearOrder α` and `WellFoundedLT α`, together with the trivial addition `OrderBot α`, already imply `ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot α` via [`IsWellOrder.conditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/ConditionallyCompleteLattice/Basic.html#IsWellOrder.conditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot). In turn, a `SuccOrder α` instance can always be defined for this type, see #15863.

I agree with @alreadydone that [`Order.IsSuccLimit`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Limit.html#Order.IsSuccLimit) is the correct notion. In my opinion, this PR should be reverted altogether.

Thanks a lot!

bors merge
This looks fine to me.

Thanks a lot!

bors merge

```suggestion
  (IsWellFounded.wf (r := (· < ·))).succ a
```
Is it a good idea to avoid `@` if we can? Somehow I always think of `@` as a code smell.
Yes, I completely agree!

```suggestion
lemma self_lt_wellOrderSucc {a b : α} (h : a < b) : a < wellOrderSucc a :=
  IsWellFounded.wf.lt_succ ⟨b, h⟩
```
I learnt the existence of this lemma from the lemma you proved ten lines earlier :-)
Thanks!

```suggestion
  · exact (IsWellOrderLimitElement.neq_bot a h.symm).elim
```
if you're interested in golfing

```suggestion
variable {a}
```
I was very surprised to find that if you have initialised `a` but not `b`, then `variable {a b}` creates `b : ?m.13006`.
Yes, this is a weird behaviour. Thanks for spotting this!

```suggestion
lemma eq_bot_or_eq_succ_or_isWellOrderLimitElement [OrderBot α] (a : α) :
    a = ⊥ ∨ (∃ b, a = wellOrderSucc b ∧ b < a) ∨ IsWellOrderLimitElement a := by
  refine or_iff_not_imp_left.2 <| fun h₁ ↦ or_iff_not_imp_left.2 <| fun h₂ ↦ ?_
  refine (IsWellOrderLimitElement.mk ⟨⊥, Ne.bot_lt h₁⟩ fun b hb ↦ ?_)
  obtain rfl | h₃ := eq_or_lt_of_le (wellOrderSucc_le hb)
  · exact (h₂ ⟨b, rfl, hb⟩).elim
  · exact ⟨wellOrderSucc b, self_lt_wellOrderSucc hb, h₃⟩
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order): limit elements in well-ordered types

I found this PR from #12211. I think instead of building a separate IsWellOrderLimitElement API, we should make [SuccOrder.ofLinearWellFoundedLT](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Basic.html#SuccOrder.ofLinearWellFoundedLT) locally an instance to equip the well order with a SuccOrder structure and use `SuccOrder.succ` and [Order.IsSuccLimit](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Limit.html#Order.IsSuccLimit). This is the approach taken in my #9480.

The instances `LinearOrder α` and `WellFoundedLT α`, together with the trivial addition `OrderBot α`, already imply `ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot α` via [`IsWellOrder.conditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/ConditionallyCompleteLattice/Basic.html#IsWellOrder.conditionallyCompleteLinearOrderBot). In turn, a `SuccOrder α` instance can always be defined for this type, see #15863.

I agree with @alreadydone that [`Order.IsSuccLimit`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/SuccPred/Limit.html#Order.IsSuccLimit) is the correct notion. In my opinion, this PR should be reverted altogether.
